intro: Euphorbia atrococca var. kilaueana, commonly known as the Kilauea euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to Hawaii. It features a thick, fleshy stem with a distinctive red or orange coloration, often covered in small, spiny tubercles. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
